==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|しょう|ちゅう|yomi=o}}

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|しょうちゅう|acc=3}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|しょうちゅう|kyu=燒酎|hhira=せうちう}}

# [[shochu]]: a Japanese alcoholic beverage, most commonly [[distill]]ed from barley, [[sweet potato]], or [[rice]]
#: Typically 25% alcohol by volume ([[ABV]]), making it weaker than [[whisky]], but stronger than [[wine]] and [[sake]]. Higher-[[proof]] versions are also available, with ABV levels of 40-50%.

====Derived terms====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|芋焼酎|いも-じょうちゅう}}: sweet potato shochu
* {{ja-r|米焼酎|こめ-じょうちゅう}}: rice shochu
* {{ja-r|チューハイ}}: shochu [[highball]], though commonly now made with neutral grain spirits
{{der-bottom}}

{{der-top|See also}}
